explanation:
Correct calculation: 120% of 50 = 1.2 × 50 = 60  
Student's incorrect calculation: 50 ÷ 5 = 10  

The student likely converted 120% to 20% by misinterpreting the percentage value, then calculated 20% of 50 as (50 ÷ 5) = 10. This error stems from a failure to recognize that percentages greater than 100% require calculations exceeding the original amount.  

The flaw occurred when the student treated 120% as if only the "20" portion mattered, ignoring the full percentage value. This aligns with misunderstanding percentages over 100%, not merely calculating 10% or division errors. Unlike the 10% misconception (which would yield 5), the error specifically reflects truncation of the percentage value due to unacknowledged magnitude.
